greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0, for primes p, a(p) = 1, and for any other number n, a(n) = max(A003415(n), A276086(n)).
comment: Apart from primes p, for which a(p) = 1, the only duplicated values among the first 65537 terms are a(30040) = a(32344) = 51108 and a(30150) = a(60278) = 47685.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2310
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
program: A276086(n) = { my(i=0,m=1,pr=1,nextpr); while((n>0),i=i+1; nextpr = prime(i)*pr; if((n%nextpr),m*=(prime(i)^((n%nextpr)/pr));n-=(n%nextpr));pr=nextpr); m; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 07 2019
